intro: Toxocarpus letouzeanus, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant features opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and prominent stamens. Toxocarpus letouzeanus is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
